dt.t: a quality that {wi}shouts{/wi} from good novels

dt: {bc}to cause to be, come, or stop by or as if by shouting

shortdef: to utter a sudden loud cry
to command attention as if by shouting
to utter in a loud voice

dt: {bc}a public expression of greeting, praise, or acknowledgement directed toward a person or group often as part of a performance, recording, or broadcast

dt.t: She opened her acceptance speech with a {wi}shout-out{/wi} to James Baldwin, the author of the book on which the movie was based, calling him {ldquo}one of the greatest artists of our time.{rdquo}
Here are a few lyrical {wi}shout-outs{/wi} to some of hip hop's favorite designers.
She even gave a {wi}shoutout{/wi} to one of her former teachers on Twitter, and encouraged others to do the same.

shortdef: a public expression of greeting, praise, or acknowledgement directed toward a person or group often as part of a performance, recording, or broadcast

dt: {bc}a strongly rhythmic religious song of the African American folk tradition that is characterized by responsive singing or shouting between leader and congregation

shortdef: a strongly rhythmic religious song of the African American folk tradition that is characterized by responsive singing or shouting between leader and congregation

dt: {bc}to shout so that (someone who is speaking) cannot be heard

dt.t: The crowd {it}shouted{/it} him {it}down{/it} when he tried to give his speech.

shortdef: to shout so that (someone who is speaking) cannot be heard

dt: {bc}to shout because one is very happy

shortdef: to shout because one is very happy

dt: {bc}to make one's voice hoarse by shouting

shortdef: to make one's voice hoarse by shouting

dt: {bc}to have a good chance of winning or achieving something

dt.t: We aren't too far behind, so we{it}'re{/it} still {it}in with a shout{/it}.

shortdef: to have a good chance of winning or achieving something

dt: {bc}to tell (someone) about something when it happens or is ready to be done

dt.t: I'll {it}give{/it} you {it}a shout{/it} when it's time to leave.

shortdef: to tell (someone) about something when it happens or is ready to be done

dt.t: She had to {phrase}shout her head off{/phrase} to get her friends attention at the concert.
He is shy at first, but will {phrase}talk your head off{/phrase} {gloss}=will talk continuously{/gloss} once you get to know him.
You can {phrase}yell your head off{/phrase} at him, but he still won't listen.
They will be {phrase}laughing their heads off{/phrase} when they see my costume.
